```{r}
#| label: printing-fuctions
#| echo: false

wrap_li <- function(text = "text", fa = "fas fa-graduation-cap") {
  li <- paste0("<li><i class='fa-li ", fa, "'></i>", text, "</li>\n")
  return(li)
}

print_list <- function(text = "text", fa = "fas fa-graduation-cap") {
  open_ul  <- "<ul class='ul-edu fa-ul'>"
  close_ul <- "</ul>"
  items    <- wrap_li(text, fa)

  cat(paste0(open_ul, "\n"), items, paste0("\n", close_ul))
}

```

#### Rutgers University

<p align="justify">
Hi! I'm Robert, a PhD student in the department of Spanish & Portuguese at Rutgers University in New Brunswick, NJ. I study bilingualism and second language acquisition. I'm particularly interested in the acquisition of phonology and phonetics in bilinguals, with a special focus on prosody and intonation. I'm also interested in statistical analysis and open science practices.
